Once the dpkg command has been executed, the Couchbase server starts automatically, and is configured to automatically start during boot under the 2, 3, 4, and 5 runlevels. Refer to the Ubuntu documentation for more information about installing packages using the Debian package manager.

section.p: After successful installation, use the service command to manage the Couchbase Server service, including checking the current status. Refer to the Ubuntu documentation for instructions. To provide initial setup for Couchbase, open a web browser and access the web administration interface. See Initial Server Setup.
